translation.text: Airport & South Line, Bankstown Line - Delays

due to signal equipment repairs at Redfern. We are working hard to rectify the issue as quick as possible, however delays to some services will continue and increased journey times may be experienced.
Inner West & Leppington Line, Western Line - Delays

Delays in both directions due to signal equipment repairs at Redfern We are working hard to rectify the issue as quick as possible, however delays to some services will continue and increased journey times may be experienced. Please allow additional travel time, use real time apps for updates and listen to announcements as some stopping patterns and platforms may change at short notice.

Services in both directions are experiencing delays of up to 20 minutes due to signal equipment repairs at Redfern. Repair crews on-site and are working hard to rectify the issue as quickly as possible.
Your service may depart from a different platform than usual and may have altered stops. You may also have to change trains to complete your journey. 
Please allow additional travel time, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for service information.

*Limited capacity events - attendees travelling by public transport should allow plenty of additional travel time and plan ahead by checking real-time capacity indicators where available as you may need to wait for the next service with available physical distancing capacity*

Winter Challenge Race Day - Rosehill Gardens, Rosehill
11:30 to 17:00
- The best station for connection to Rosehills Gardens is Parramatta. Change at Parramatta for a bus service departing from Valentine Ave on the southern side of Parramatta Interchange to Rosehill.

NRL: Warriors v Roosters - Central Coast Stadium, Gosford
15:00 to 16:45
- The closest station to Central Coast Stadium is Gosford on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line however trackwork is taking place with buses replacing trains between Newcastle Interchange and Central so allow extra travel time and plan your trip ahead of time.
- The stadium is a short walk from the station via Showground Road and Dane Drive.

AFL: Sydney Swans v Hawthorn Hawks - Sydney Cricket Ground, Moore Park
15:35 to 17:50
- The closest station to the SCG is Central. From there catch a light rail service or shuttle bus to Moore Park leaving from Chalmers Street.
- Fans can also walk between Central and Moore Park via Devonshire St and the Albert 'Tibby' Cotter Walkway to minimise wait times for transport services.

NRL: Sharks v Dragons - Netstrata Jubilee Stadium, Kogarah
17:30 to 19:15
- The closest station to Netstrata Jubilee Stadium is Carlton on the T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line. The stadium is a 10 minute walk from the station via Jubilee Avenue.

Details: https://transportnsw.info/events/2020/07

Until Wednesday 9 September the lift that goes from the concourse to street level will be closed for maintenance. If you require a lift or easy access you may wish to consider using Central as an alternative. If you require further assistance please see station staff or call 8337 8400.
The lift between the concourse and platform 5 is temporarily out of service.
The lift between the concourse and platform 4 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9563 7273.
The lift between platforms 1/2 and the footbridge is closed for upgrade work until 22 September 2020. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 4349 9110.

From 14 June to 16 August 2020 the lift between the concourse and platforms 1 and 2 is temporarily unavailable due to scheduled upgrade works. If you require a lift or easy access please change at Mount Druitt or Werrington stations to get to your destination. For further assistance, please see station staff or call 9851 7525.

There are changes to Platforms 18 and 19 at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works.   Hoarding for the Central Walk excavation work has moved from the middle of the platform to the southern end of the platform.  Temporary concrete ramps connect the existing platform floor surface and the new concrete surface areas.   For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff.   For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works visit sydneymetro.info.

There are changes to Platforms 16 and 17 at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works.    Hoarding for the Central Walk excavation work has moved from the middle of the platform to the southern end of the platform. Temporary concrete ramps connect the existing platform floor surface and the new concrete floor surface areas.   For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff.    If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight from Platforms 16 and 17, please board via the front door of the fourth train carriage.   For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works, visit sydneymetro.info.

From 12am Saturday 25 July to 4am Monday 27 July 2020: the stairs, escalators and lift between the Grand Concourse and Northern Concourse at Central Station will be closed for Sydney Metro construction works. The Suburban Tunnel will also be closed during this period.  Alternative stairs, escalators and lift are available outside the Opal gates. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works visit sydneymetro.info.

From Saturday 25 July to Sunday 9 August, the Suburban Tunnel will be temporarily closed for Sydney Metro construction works. Access for Platforms 16 to 23 is only via the Northern Concourse or Southern Tunnel during this period.  You can view a map of the station here https://transportnsw.info/media/4930/central-station-map.pdf

From Wednesday 10 June to Wednesday 9 September the lift that goes from the concourse to street level will be closed for maintenance. If you require a lift or easy access you may wish to consider using Central as an alternative. If you require further assistance please see station staff or call 8337 8400.

During the current upgrade of Mittagong Station access points to the station have changed.  Entry/exit to the station via Regent St is through the Southern/Moss Vale end of the station building.  Entry/exit to the station via Railway Pde is through the Southern/Moss Vale end of the shelter on the platform. Please allow additional time to access the station as a reduced number of parking spaces are available during the upgrade.

From 14 June to 16 August 2020 the lift between the concourse and platforms 1 and 2 is temporarily unavailable due to scheduled upgrade works. If you require a lift or easy access please change at Mount Druitt or Werrington stations to get to your destination. For further assistance, please see station staff or call 9851 7525.

New Metro Platforms are being constructed on platforms 1 & 2 at Sydenham Station. T3 Bankstown Line services to the City operate from platform 3 & T3 Bankstown Line services to Lidcombe and Liverpool operate from platform 4. Platform 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works - A new Metro concourse is also being constructed at the Northern end of the station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please see staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
